**Summary**
• World Liberty Financial (WLFI) blacklisted Justin Sun's address, freezing $107 million worth of WLFI tokens.
• The reason for the blacklisting is currently not clearly stated in the provided context.
• This action prevents Sun from moving or selling the blacklisted tokens.
• The blacklisting may be related to regulatory compliance, internal policy changes, or a dispute between WLFI and Justin Sun.

**Why it matters**
• For users/investors: The blacklisting highlights the risks associated with holding tokens that can be controlled by a central entity, potentially leading to sudden asset freezes.
• For builders: This event underscores the importance of decentralization and transparency in token design to avoid similar situations.

**Risks**
• The value of WLFI tokens could be negatively affected due to uncertainty and concerns about centralized control.

**Opportunities**
• Other projects may capitalize on this situation by offering more decentralized and transparent alternatives.

**Market view**
Market — Increased scrutiny on projects with centralized control over tokens.

**Sources**
https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2025/09/04/world-liberty-financial-blacklists-justin-sun-s-address-with-usd107m-wlfi
